intro: Iris fominii, commonly known as the Siberian iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Asia. It features upright, sword-shaped leaves and produces showy, violet-blue flowers with three upright petals and three drooping sepals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to naturalize readily. The species is also valued for its ecological benefits, providing nectar for pollinators.
